Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech in Australia.
The ability to express differing views is a cornerstone of democracy.
The bill could lead to an authoritarian-like control over public discourse.
Decisions on misinformation may reflect government narratives, which are not always correct.
Notable Quotes: If this Bill is passed, the people of this nation will wake up wandering whether they have been transported to North Korea or China.
Allow Australia to continue to be a democratic nation, where freedom of speech can be heard.
